etymology.description: 覀(覀) (yà, "west") + 示(示) (shì, "show") = show identity or value -> implying a ticket or note
etymology.interpretation: The character 票(票) (piào, "ticket") combines elements denoting direction and display, conceptualizing a document that demonstrates or verifies identity or value, like a ticket or banknote.

examples.chinese: 我买了一张票(我買了一張票)。
他订了电影票(他訂了電影票)，准备去看电影(準備去看電影)。
examples.pinyin: Tā dìngle diànyǐng piào, zhǔnbèi qù kàn diànyǐng.
examples.english: He booked a movie ticket, preparing to watch a film.

examples.chinese: 演唱会的票很快就卖完了(演唱會的票很快就賣完了)。
examples.pinyin: Yǎnchànghuì de piào hěn kuài jiù màiwánle.
examples.english: The tickets for the concert sold out quickly.
